headline.main: Opinion: The Death of the Cyberflâneur

docs.snippet: Today's Internet is a place for getting things done, pushing aside the cyberflaneur - the heir to the flaneur culture of 19th-century France....
docs.abstract: Today's Internet is a place for getting things done, pushing aside the cyberflaneur - the heir to the flaneur culture of 19th-century France.

headline.main: Opinion: The Death of the Cyberflâneur

docs.snippet: Today's Internet is a place for getting things done, pushing aside the cyberflâneur - the heir to the flâneur culture of 19th-century France....
docs.abstract: Today's Internet is a place for getting things done, pushing aside the cyberflâneur - the heir to the flâneur culture of 19th-century France.
docs.lead_paragraph: The flâneur would leisurely stroll through Paris streets and especially its arcades. Cyberflâneurs, however, are few and far between, while the very practice of cyberflânerie seems at odds with the world of social media, writes Evgeny Morozov in an Opinion piece in The New York Times. What went wrong? And should we worry? Read more »

headline.main: One Test Left for Romney: The Midwest

docs.snippet: If Mr. Romney loses the Republican presidential nomination, it is likely to be because of the one region that has yet to give him a victory: the Midwest....
docs.abstract: If Mr. Romney loses the Republican presidential nomination, it is likely to be because of the one region that has yet to give him a victory: the Midwest.

headline.main: One Test Left for Romney: The Midwest

docs.snippet: If Mitt Romney loses the nomination, it is likely to be because of the one region that has yet to give him a victory: the Midwest....
docs.abstract: If Mitt Romney loses the nomination, it is likely to be because of the one region that has yet to give him a victory: the Midwest.
docs.lead_paragraph: Saturday's victory in the Nevada caucuses gives Mitt Romney double-digit wins in three of the four major regions of the country: the Northeast (New Hampshire), the West (Nevada) and the South (Florida).

headline.print_headline: ‘Chronicle’ Leads on Slow Weekend for Movies
headline.main: 'Chronicle' Leads the Way at Movie Theaters

docs.snippet: This low-budget film about three teenage boys who learn they have superpowers was No. 1 at North American theaters over the weekend, taking in about $22 million....
docs.abstract: This low-budget film about three teenage boys who learn they have superpowers was No. 1 at North American theaters over the weekend, taking in about $22 million.

headline.main: 'Chronicle' Leads the Way at Movie Theaters

docs.snippet: This low-budget film about three teenage boys who learn they have superpowers was No. 1 at North American theaters over the weekend, taking in about $22 million....
docs.abstract: This low-budget film about three teenage boys who learn they have superpowers was No. 1 at North American theaters over the weekend, taking in about $22 million.
docs.lead_paragraph: Score one for 20th Century Fox, whose low-budget movie "Chronicle" turned out a bigger-than-expected crowd at theaters on what is typically one of Hollywood's slowest weekends of the year. "Chronicle," about three teenage boys who learn they have superpowers, was No. 1 at North American theaters, taking in about $22 million, according to Hollywood.com, which compiles box office data.

docs.snippet: Despite his weak showing in Nevada, Newt Gingrich says he is well-placed to do well in the March 6 "Super Tuesday" contests....
docs.abstract: Despite his weak showing in Nevada, Newt Gingrich says he is well-placed to do well in the March 6 "Super Tuesday" contests.

docs.snippet: Despite his weak showing in Nevada, Newt Gingrich says he is well-placed to do well in the March 6 "Super Tuesday" contests....
docs.abstract: Despite his weak showing in Nevada, Newt Gingrich says he is well-placed to do well in the March 6 "Super Tuesday" contests.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON -- Newt Gingrich on Sunday brushed aside his second consecutive lopsided loss, saying that by the time "Super Tuesday" rolled around on March 6, his struggling campaign would find itself in "much more favorable territory."

headline.main: Take This Mitt, and Pass Me the Broadsword

docs.snippet: Curt Schilling, the former Boston Red Sox pitcher, left baseball to start 38 Studios, a video game company, maker of Kingdoms of Amalur: Reckoning. Read more »...
